oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Undersown catch crops as a source of biomass for energy
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Niemeläinen, Oiva
Jauhiainen, Lauri
Kontturi, Markku
Nissinen, Oiva
Vuorinen, Martti
Niskanen, Markku
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Italian ryegrass would need an additional nitrogen fertilizer application after cereal harvest to achieve its full yield potential. Use of legumes as undersown crops might be better in energy balance point of view. Yield of catch crops would produce suitable biomass for biogas refineries adding substantial amount to animal manure which might be the main biomass source for biogas production.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Niemeläinen, Oiva; Jauhiainen, Lauri; Kontturi, Markku; Nissinen, Oiva; Vuorinen, Martti and Niskanen, Markku (2007) Undersown catch crops as a source of biomass for energy. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 3 (4), pp. 109-110.
